s.text: In this study, we show that HIV proteins may synergize with drugs such as methamphetamine and cocaine to cause neurotoxicity.

These findings are supported by recent observations suggesting that HIV infected drug abusers have a more severe encephalitis at autopsy [ 7, 8, 9] and at least in some HIV infected drug abusers an accelerated form of HIV dementia may be observed [ 21].

Although no major differences were noted in cognitive functioning amongst HIV-infected asymptomatics with or without a history of drug abuse [ 6], a subsequent study showed that a history of injection drug use and presentation with prominent psychomotor slowing was associated with more rapid neurologic progression [ 7].

Although no major differences were noted in cognitive functioning amongst HIV-infected asymptomatics with or without a history of drug abuse [ 6], a subsequent study showed that a history of injection drug use and presentation with prominent psychomotor slowing was associated with more rapid neurologic progression [ 7].
As demonstrated in these studies, at least in part the mechanism involves mitochondrial dysfunction.

For ER? and ER? PCR, 1.5 U of Taq Ab (Life Technologies) was included in each reaction.

Estrogen deficiency has been implicated as a risk factor in the development of several neurodegenerative diseases [ 16, 17, 18] and estrogen replacement may result in improvement of cognitive function [ 19].

Interestingly, some investigators have proposed the use of psychostimulants in the treatment of HIV dementia [ 13], however the effects of these drugs on cerebral function in the setting of HIV infection has not been well studied.
Cell were fixed in Zamboni's solution, rinsed 3-fold in PBS, and incubated with mouse anti-ER? or ER? monoclonal antibodies (1:10 dilution) for at least 1 h at room temperature.
We found that 5-10% cells immunostained for estrogen receptors.
